author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Closing in favor of https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/138632

Please do not modify the version number when modifying pending registration

Also: do not manually create tags in git. [Your project is using TagBot](https://github.com/Mehdilotfi7/Mica/blob/main/.github/workflows/TagBot.yml) to tag releases automatically after the registration has gone through.

In any case, even if you weren't using TagBot, tags must be created _after_ registration, not before

Hi @goerz, thanks a lot for your guidance 
I have now cleaned up the repository (removed the large PDF / LFS issue).
Should I simply wait for the current registration PR (v0.1.0) to proceed,
or should I re-trigger registration with [at]JuliaRegistrator register?
Thanks for clarifying!
You have to retrigger the registration, but keep `0.1.1` as the version number. That will update the existing https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/138632

body:
- Registering package: Mica
- Repository: https://github.com/Mehdilotfi7/Mica
- Created by: @Mehdilotfi7
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: ae4fd2582b2de72e617c31f77e65a1b03a78eac7
- Reviewed by: @Mehdilotfi7
- Reference: https://github.com/Mehdilotfi7/Mica/issues/10#issuecomment-3298443590
- Description: Mocha is a Julia package for change point detection in time series models, identifying points where model parameters change and segmenting accordingly for more accurate simulation.
- Release notes:
<!-- BEGIN RELEASE NOTES -->
`````
- Initial release of **Mica.jl**
- Model-Informed Changepoint Analysis framework
- Supports ODE, difference equation, and regression models
- Evolutionary optimization for parameter estimation
- Examples: epidemiology (Covid) and engineering (Wind turbine)
`````
<!-- END RELEASE NOTES -->

<!--  -->
title: New package: Mica v0.1.0
